alert.note: Alert for Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 11:13AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of the Kaibab Platea in Coconino County through 1145 AM MST... At 1110 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from the North Rim to Jacobs Lake, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... House Rock, Jacob Lake, North Rim Entrance Station, Demotte Campground, Mangum Fire scar, and Jacob Lake Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 67 between mile markers 580 and 610. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 556 and 594. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward
